name: backdate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make something, especially a pay increase, effective from an earlier time: They got a pay rise in March that was backdated to January. Compare
predate
postdate (HAPPEN AFTER)

Add to word list
Add to word list
to make something effective from a date earlier than the present date: They agreed that the pay increase would be backdated to July. Those signing up before October will have their pension payments backdated.
to put a date on a document that is earlier than the date when you wrote it: The jury's verdict recognized that backdating options with intent to deceive is a crime. backdate a cheque Compare
post-date
